intro: Polystachya johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's spikegrass, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is a terrestrial herb characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with elongated, leafy stems. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink or purple. Polystachya johnstonii is notable for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its role in local ecosystems as a source of nectar for pollinators.
